File file = new File("file.txt");
String modificationTime = file.lastModified();
PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter("file.txt");

writer.close();

Explanation:
The code above creates a new File object and gets the last modification time of the file using the lastModified() method. The modification time is then written to the file using the PrintWriter.write() method. The PrintWriter is opened with the "file.txt" file and the content is written to the file. Finally, the PrintWriter is closed to ensure that the changes are saved to the file.

By using the lastModified() method, you can get the modification time of the file, but it may not be accurate if the file is being accessed by other programs. To get more accurate modification time, you can use the File.lastModified() method, but it requires a file lock to be acquired before calling the method, which may cause performance issues. The PrintWriter.write() method is a simple way to write the modification time to the file without requiring a file lock.
